paper_abstract: Let alpha be an irrational number with 0 < alpha < 1, and let f(alpha) be the characteristic word of alpha. The location of a factor w of f(alpha) is defined to be the set of all positions in f(alpha) at which w occurs. In this paper, an explicit formula of the location of each factor in of f(alpha) is obtained. The decompositions RED(alpha) (w) and SOD(alpha) (w) of f(alpha) associated with in are established. The former one involves all return words of in while the latter one involves all occurrences of in and the corresponding separate factors and overlap factors. These results generalize the work by the present authors (2005), Z.-X. Wen and Z.-Y. Wen (1994), G. Melancon (1999), W.-T. Cao and Z.-Y. Wen (2003), I.M. Araujo and V. Bruyere (2005), and A. Glen (2006). (C) 2010 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Factors of characteristic words: Location and decompositions
